IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: DEERFIELD ACADEMY IS AN INDEPENDENT SECONDARY SCHOOL COMMITTED TO HIGH STANDARDS OF SCHOLARSHIP, CITIZENSHIP, AND PERSONAL RESPONSIBILITY. THROUGH A RIGOROUS LIBERAL ARTS CURRICULUM, EXTENSIVE CO-CURRICULAR PROGRAM, AND SUPPORTIVE RESIDENTIAL ENVIRONMENT, DEERFIELD ENCOURAGES EACH STUDENT TO DEVELOP AN INQUISITIVE AND CREATIVE MIND, SOUND BODY, AND STRONG MORAL CHARACTER.
IRS990.MissionDesc: DEERFIELD ACADEMY IS AN INDEPENDENT SECONDARY SCHOOL COMMITTED TO HIGH STANDARDS OF SCHOLARSHIP, CITIZENSHIP, AND PERSONAL RESPONSIBILITY. THROUGH A RIGOROUS LIBERAL ARTS CURRICULUM, EXTENSIVE CO-CURRICULAR PROGRAM, AND SUPPORTIVE RESIDENTIAL ENVIRONMENT, DEERFIELD ENCOURAGES EACH STUDENT TO DEVELOP AN INQUISITIVE AND CREATIVE MIND, SOUND BODY, AND STRONG MORAL CHARACTER.
IRS990.Desc: DURING THE 2015-2016 ACADEMIC YEAR, 569 BOARDING AND 69 DAY STUDENTS WERE ENROLLED AT DEERFIELD ACADEMY. OUR PROGRAMS OF SECONDARY EDUCATION (GRADES 9-12) INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT OF OUR STUDENTS' ACADEMIC AND SCHOLARSHIP SKILLS, CITIZENSHIP AND CHARACTER. COMMUNITY SERVICE, ATHLETIC PROGRAMS AND EXTRA-CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES ARE INTEGRATED AS A PART OF THE SCHOOL'S LONGSTANDING INTELLECTUAL AND MORAL TRADITION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONTRIBUTIONS OF ASSETS OTHER THAN CASH ARE RECORDED AT THEIR ESTIMATED FAIR VALUE AT THE DATE OF GIFT EXCEPT THAT CONTRIBUTIONS OF WORKS OF ART, HISTORICAL TREASURES AND SIMILAR ASSETS HELD AS PART OF COLLECTIONS ARE NOT RECOGNIZED OR CAPITALIZED.

DEERFIELD ACADEMY MAINTAINS A COLLECTION OF ART AND HISTORICAL ITEMS FOR USE IN ITS ADVANCEMENT OF STUDENT EDUCATION AND AS A RESOURCE FOR THE STUDY AND EXPLORATION OF ART, HISTORY, CULTURE, CURRENT AFFAIRS, AESTHETICS, AND MEDIA.
FINANCIAL AID, FACULTY SALARIES, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, GENERAL OPERATIONS, AND OTHER.
GRANTS-FINANCIAL AID & TUITION REMISSION -9,583,230. UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX EXPENSE -221,760. INVESTMENT EXPENSE -803,311.
GRANTS-FINANCIAL AID & TUITION REMISSION 9,583,230. UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX EXPENSE 221,760. INVESTMENT EXPENSE 803,311.
BY PUBLICATION IN REGIONAL NEWSPAPERS - "THE BOSTON GLOBE". THIS IS DONE ANNUALLY.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: BIG BROTHERSBIG SISTERS OF FRANKLIN COUNTY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANTS ARE PROVIDED VIA A REDUCTION IN TUITION.

FIRST CLASS TRAVEL IS ALLOWED FOR INTERNATIONAL TRIPS ONLY. CERTAIN PERSONAL SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND SPOUSE, TO ASSIST THEM IN FULFILLING THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES TO THE ACADEMY. THESE POLICIES ARE IN WRITING. EMPLOYEES WHO ARE PROVIDED HOUSING ARE REQUIRED TO LIVE ON CAMPUS AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT. THESE HOMES ARE AVAILABLE FOR HOUSING VISITORS AND FOR OTHER USES DURING SCHOOL SPONSORED EVENTS.

FIRST CLASS TRAVEL IS ALLOWED FOR INTERNATIONAL TRIPS ONLY. CERTAIN PERSONAL SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND SPOUSE, TO ASSIST THEM IN FULFILLING THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES TO THE ACADEMY. THESE POLICIES ARE IN WRITING.

MARGARITA O'BYRNE CURTIS PARTICIPATES IN A 457(F) PLAN. SEPARATELY, MARGARITA O'BYRNE CURTIS AND DAVID POND HAVE NONQUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION AGREEMENTS WITH THE ACADEMY. DAVID POND RECEIVED PAYMENTS FROM HIS NONQUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION AGREEMENT OF $150,000 DURING CALENDAR YEAR 2015.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: TO EXPAND AND RENOVATE THE FINE ARTS BUILDING

DEERFIELD ACADEMY USES A STOCKBROKER TO SELL GIFTS OF PUBLICLY TRADED SECURITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXISTING BOARD MEMBERS VOTE IN NEW BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COPIES OF THIS 2015 FORM 990 WERE SENT TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND THE BOARD PRESIDENT, VICE PRESIDENT AND TREASURER, WHICH REPRESENTS APPROXIMATELY 30% OF THE ENTIRE BOARD. PRIOR TO FILING, A MEETING WITH THE AUDIT COMMITTEE MEMBERS AND MANAGEMENT TOOK PLACE IN ORDER TO REVIEW THE RETURN AND ANSWER ALL QUESTIONS. THIS FORM 990, EXCLUDING SCHEDULE B, WAS PROVIDED TO ALL OTHER MEMBERS OF THE BOARD FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BY-LAWS PROHIBIT A TRUSTEE FROM VOTING, APPROVING, OR MAKING A RECOMMENDATION REGARDING A TRANSACTION BETWEEN THE ACADEMY AND AN ENTITY IN WHICH THE INDIVIDUAL OR A MEMBER OF HIS OR HER FAMILY HAS AN OWNERSHIP INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DEERFIELD ACADEMY'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES OVERSEES THE COMPENSATION OF THE ACADEMY'S TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS. HEAD OF SCHOOL - THE PERSONNEL & COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWS SALARY AND PERQUISITE DATA FROM OTHER INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS FOR THE POSITION OF HEAD OF SCHOOL TO ENSURE SALARIES ARE REASONABLE AND APPROPRIATE TO THE MARKET. MINUTES OF THE PERSONNEL & COMPENSATION COMMITTEE MEETING ARE MAINTAINED DOCUMENTING THE DISCUSSIONS REGARDING THE SALARY SETTING FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL. SENIOR STAFF - THE HEAD OF SCHOOL REVIEWS, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD, SALARY AND PERQUISITE DATA FROM OTHER INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS FOR OTHER TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS, TO ENSURE SALARIES ARE REASONABLE AND APPROPRIATE TO THE MARKET.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.
